Menubar component

A menu that is visually persistent is a menubar. A menubar is typically horizontal and is often used to create a menu bar similar to those found near the top of the window in many desktop applications, offering the user quick access to a consistent set of commands.

It can be seen as a composite of menuitems and dropdown menus

Supported keyboard interactions

Here are the supported keyboard interactions

When focus on is a menu item which can expand a submenu (direct child of the menu bar)

  • down arrow, enter, space will open the submenu if not yet opened.
  • up arrow, enter, space will close the submenu if already opened.
  • left arrow will go the previous menu item in the menu bar.
  • right arrow will go to the next menu item in the menu bar.
  • tab will focus the next focusable element in the source flow leaving the menubar.

When focus is on a menu item inside of an expanded sub menu (nested child).

  • down arrow will go to the next menu item inside the submenu.
  • up arrow will go to the previous menu item inside the submenu.
  • esc will close the submenu and focus the submenu pop up button.
  • left arrow will close the submenu and select the previous item in the menubar.
  • right arrow will close the submenu and select the next item in the menubar.
  • tab will focus the next focusable element in the source flow leaving and closing the submenu.

Method and comments

As a menu bar would be a set of grouped actions, it may not be relevant/easy to have it working without Javascript and we are going to consider for this example that Javascript is available.

Markup

There is a specification draft on a eventually new menu html element whose read might help to understand what is expected for such a component

The container with the role menubar will be persistent and each item will have the role menuitem

We follow the currently provided example of sub memus on mozilla documentation for menu and menuitem html5 elements. If you don't follow the pattern, the event handling may be buggy

Sub menu will have a button with aria-haspopup attribute. We put the tabindex to -1 except on the first item to make sure the tab sequence remains short (lrtiste will update them accordingly to the component state)


<div id="menubar-sample">
  <ul role="menubar">
    <li role="menuitem">
      <button id="b1" type="button" aria-haspopup="true" tabindex="0" aria-controls="submenu1">Menu 1</button>
      <ul id="submenu1" aria-labelledby="b1" role="menu">
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 1.1</li>
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 1.2</li>
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 1.3</li>
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 1.4</li>
      </ul>
    </li>
    <li role="menuitem">
      <button id="b2" type="button" aria-haspopup="true" tabindex="-1" aria-controls="submenu2">Menu 2</button>
      <ul id="submenu2" aria-labelledby="b2" role="menu">
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 2.1</li>
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 2.2</li>
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 2.3</li>
      </ul>
    </li>
    <li role="menuitem"><span>Some single action</span></li>
    <li role="menuitem" aria-haspopup="true">
      <button id="b4" type="button" aria-haspopup="true" tabindex="-1" aria-controls="submenu4">Menu 3</button>
      <ul id="submenu4" aria-labelledby="b4" role="menu">
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 4.1</li>
        <li role="menuitem">sub action 4.2</li>
      </ul>
    </li>
  </ul>
</div>

Style and script

  • Style
  • Script

    • theme.css

    [role=menubar] {
    display: flex;
    width: 100%;
    border: 1px solid #5e7eff;
    border-radius: 0.3rem;
}

[role=menubar] ul,
ul[role=menubar] {
    list-style: none;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
}

/* a kind of reset to align the theme of popup button to regular menu items*/
[role=menubar] button[aria-haspopup] {
    font: inherit;
    border: none;
    box-shadow: none;
}

[role=menubar] [role=menuitem] {
    flex-grow: 1;
    display: flex;
    align-items: stretch;
    justify-content: center;
    flex-wrap: wrap;
}

/*leaf menu items (increase click/touch area)*/
[role=menubar] [role=menuitem] [role=menuitem],
[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem] > span {
    padding: 0.5rem;
}

[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem],
[role=menubar] button[aria-haspopup=true] {
    position: relative;
    color: #5e7eff;
    background: white;
}

/* keyboard users feedback*/
[role=menubar] [role=menuitem]:focus,
[role=menubar] button[aria-haspopup=true]:focus {
    background: #5e7eff;
    color: white;
    transition: all 0.5s;
    outline: none;
}

/* mouse user feedback*/
[role=menubar] [role=menuitem]:hover,
[role=menubar] button[aria-haspopup=true]:hover {
    background: #93a8ff;
    color: white;
    transition: all 0.5s;
}

[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem] > *:first-child {
    flex-basis: 100%;
    text-align: center;
    font-weight: bolder;
}

/* arrow adorners*/
[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem] > [aria-haspopup=true]:after {
    content: '\25be\0020';
    padding-left: 0.5rem;
}

[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem] > [aria-haspopup=true][aria-expanded=true]:after {
    content: '\25b4\0020';
}

[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem]:not(:last-child) {
    border-right: 1px solid #5e7eff;
}

[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem] [role=menu] {
    position: absolute;
    border-radius: 0 0 0.3rem 0.3rem;
    display: inline-block;
    z-index: 999;
    left: 0;
    top: 100%;
    width: 100%;
    background: white;
    color: #242424;
    border-top: 1px solid #5e7eff;
    box-shadow: 0 0.2rem 0.4rem 0 #858585, 0 0.1rem 0 0 #545454;
}

[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem] [role=menu][aria-hidden=true] {
    display: none;
}

[role=menubar] > [role=menuitem] [role=menu][aria-hidden=false] {
    animation-name: menu-in;
    animation-duration: 0.3s;
    animation-timing-function: ease-out;
}

@keyframes menu-in {
    0% {
        transform: scaleY(0);
        transform-origin: top;
        opacity: 0;
    }
    100% {
        transform-origin: top;
        transform: scaleY(1);
        opacity: 1;
    }
}

    We try to use as much as possible semantic selector so style can be adapted to different markup

    index.js

    import {menubar} from '../../../../components/menus'

const factory = menubar();
factory({el: document.querySelector('[role=menubar]')});
